entry.title: BayPiggies January 2017 talk at LinkedIn: A Journey through Python
entry.summary:
Description

Speaker: Charles Merriam

"Python" encompasses a huge knowledge area of internals, libraries, tools, and philosophy. This talk maps the knowledge touching on the Zen of Python, decorators, dunders, Django, Jupyter and more. You will learn something new and map how Python fits together as a coherent whole.

Charles Merriam has presented to BayPiggies and PyCon many times over the years, including a 2007 talk on this same subject.

Editor's note: this talk is really great. If you are a beginner, you will learn a lot about how to wrap your head around the Python language and ecosystem. If you are an experienced Python developer, the talk will leave you with renewed enthusiasm for Python.

entry.title: Decorators From Basics to Class Decorators to Decorator Libraries (#138)
entry.summary:
Description

Decorators from Basics to Class Decorators to Decorator Libraries

Presented by Charles Merriam

Decorators simplify design and improve readability and reliability. This tutorial starts from the beginning with basic decorators, showing how simple tasks like restricting administration functions are clearer and more readable with decorators, and exactly how the decorators work. A simple library of decorators for tracing, logging, and caching results is presented. This leads into writing your own decorators and parameterized decorators either from scratch or by using libraries like Simionato's Decorator Decorator and "@call_before(fn)". Finally, using Python 3.x class decorators in place of metaclasses for most common dictionary modifications is covered.
